headline.main: World Briefing | Americas: Colombia: Rebels Admit Seizing Briton

lead_paragraph: Marxist rebels admitted that they had seized a British tourist, Jeremy Parks, but blamed the army for shooting him to death during a battle on Sunday. The National Liberation Army said that its guerrillas had pulled the 28-year-old graphic designer off a bus in western Colombia early Sunday morning. But the rebels said that they freed Mr. Parks after they came under attack by an army patrol.
abstract: Marxist rebels in Colombia admit that they had seized British tourist, Jeremy Parks, but blame army for shooting him to death during a battle (S)
